summary: This document is an email chain from June 2024 involving attorney Erica Dubno, FBI Special Agent Angela Jackson, and others, concerning urgent requests for a law enforcement support letter from the FBI for a victim's immigration application. The correspondence, spanning from 2022 to 2024, involves coordination with Sanctuary for Families and references prior interactions with AUSA Alex Rossmiller.

persons.name: Erica Dubno
persons.context: Attorney from Fahringer & Dubno leading the effort to secure a law enforcement letter from the FBI to support a victim's immigration application. She is coordinating with Sanctuary for Families and the FBI.

persons.name: Angela Jackson
persons.context: FBI Special Agent in the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking desk. She is the primary FBI contact being asked to sign and provide a support letter.

persons.name: Alex Rossmiller
persons.context: AUSA referenced as having been involved in a prior visa issue for the victim in 2020. He is copied on the 2024 email chain.

persons.name: Jessica-Wind Abolafia
persons.context: Director at Sanctuary for Families, involved in the 2022 correspondence with the FBI regarding draft documents and follow-ups for the victim's case.

connections.description: Attorney Dubno is requesting and coordinating with FBI Special Agent Jackson to obtain a crucial law enforcement support letter for a victim's immigration application.
Attorney Dubno and Director Abolafia are working together at Sanctuary for Families on behalf of a victim, coordinating with law enforcement.
FBI Special Agent Jackson corresponded with Sanctuary for Families' Director Abolafia in 2022 regarding draft documents for the victim's case.
Attorney Dubno references prior work with AUSA Rossmiller on a 2020 visa issue for the same victim and copies him on the 2024 email.

events.title: Prior Visa Issue Involvement
events.description: AUSA Alex Rossmiller was involved in addressing a visa issue for the victim, as referenced in an attached 2020 email chain.

events.title: 2022 FBI Letter Submission
events.description: The FBI provided a support letter in 2022 which was submitted in support of the victim's immigration application.

events.title: Urgent Request for Corrected FBI Letter
events.description: Attorney Erica Dubno makes an urgent request in June 2024 for a corrected law enforcement support letter from the FBI due to a discovered error in the draft, with a deadline of June 26, 2024.

keyFacts: The correspondence reveals an ongoing, multi-year effort (2020-2024) by attorneys and advocates to secure law enforcement support for a victim's immigration application, indicating the victim is seeking stability ('finally trying to put all of this behind her').
There was a critical error discovered in a draft support letter intended for submission, creating an urgent deadline situation requiring correction by the FBI.
Sanctuary for Families, through its Anti-Trafficking Initiative, is a key organization providing advocacy and legal support for the victim.

The FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, via Special Agent Angela Jackson, is the primary law enforcement entity being asked to vouch for the victim's cooperation and status.
